questions.question: Which UNESCO World Heritage Site, located in a European country known for windmills and tulips, was one of the first places to utilize a decentralized drainage system during its construction in the Middle Ages?
questions.context: This complex of windmills, built around 1740, is a testament to the Dutch ingenuity in water management.

questions.question: Which modern architectural marvel, located in the Middle East, holds the title of the world's tallest building since its completion in 2010?
questions.context: Rising over 828 meters, this skyscraper features both residential and commercial spaces, as well as an observation deck for visitors.

questions.question: Which historical battle site, pivotal in changing the course of the Second World War, is located in a city that was divided into East and West during the Cold War?
questions.context: The Battle of Stalingrad (1942-1943) was one of the deadliest battles in history and marked a turning point on the Eastern Front.

questions.question: Which famous museum in Europe is home to the 'Mona Lisa' and attracts millions of visitors annually, boasting one of the largest art collections in the world?
questions.context: Originally a royal palace, the Louvre became a public museum in 1793 during the French Revolution.

questions.question: Which ancient ruin, located in a South American country known for its rich Incan history, is situated over 2,400 meters above sea level and overlooks the Urubamba River valley?
questions.context: This 15th-century Incan citadel was rediscovered for the outside world in 1911 by Hiram Bingham, igniting global fascination.
